one's a huge pain in the ass if you ever
realize that your automation stops
working make sure the re-enable
automation button is off if it's lit up

disabling your current automation why
this happens you may have tweaked

it then temporarily disables that

Arrangement but not copy the automation
locate this lock button and this will
lock your envelopes allow you to copy
the clip but not the automation now
let's say you want to record automation
you hit record you start changing the
parameter and you're midi notes
disappear make sure midi overdub is
turned on and this will allow you to
automate a parameter without it deleting
the midi notes for that Center
instrument have you ever tried to click
and drag to Loop out an audio clip or a
midi clip and it's just not working in
the clip view make sure the loop button
is engaged and now you can click and
drag the end of the clip and it will
continue to Loop that clip if you want
to solo multiple instruments at the same
time hold command down and now you can
click the S button on two three four
however many sounds you'd like and you
will hear just those Sounds playing
together if you press play and your
screen starts to move and follow the
playhead make sure you turn off the
follow button located at the top of the
screen this will keep your windows
stationary and on the flip side if you
do want your arrangement to follow the
playhead well well yeah you could just
turn on the follow button if you ever
notice that a midi or audio clip is
grayed out and says deactivated in the
clip press 0 on your keyboard and this
allows you to activate or deactivate
that specific clip this is also helpful
when you're working and you want to just
turn off a specific clip but not delete
it just press zero if you're moving
Clips around your Arrangement window and
finding it hard to snap them to the grid
right click and check out the settings
that you're using you could start by
choosing fixed values which will adjust
the grid to 16th notes eighth notes
quarter notes you can even have a
triplet Grid in here they also give you
this adaptive grid mode which is kind of
cool it will change based on the zoom
level that you have in your Arrangement
window so when you zoom in it will be
smaller values think 16th note 30 second
notes when you zoom out it'll do larger
values quarter notes half notes a full
bar you could adjust the Adaptive grid
sensitivity by choosing between the
widest wide medium narrow and narrowest
options you might have run into issues
in the past where you open up an old
Ableton project and it can't locate the
audio files get in the habit of using
collect all and save instead of save as
for your projects what this does is
creates a folder that has the project
end all of the audio samples you used in
that project together in one space as
you preview samples through the browser
on the left side of your screen you can
adjust their volume using the preview
cue parameter this is great when you
want to hear those samples or sounds at
the same level as your production or mix
if you'd like to be able to hear the
midi notes as you drag them through the

color that tells you it's on have you
ever wondered where the presets are for
all the stock plugins and effects click
the arrow next to its name and that will

Tab and you're going to notice there's

Windows you want to turn this off by

but this only allows you to see the

single clip so if you have something
like a kick or a clap or a hat it will
literally fade that transient if your
CPU meter is overloading and you're
hearing those nasty skips and stutters
open up the preferences go to audio and
change your buffer size how this works
is the lower the numeric value the more
CPU your computer will use the higher
the numeric value the less CPU your
computer will use the general rule of
thumb is when you're recording an
instrument let's say playing your synth
use a lower numeric value it will
increase the CPU but it creates less
delay so you could actually play in time
now when you're done recording you could
increase that numeric value again it
will use less CPU from your computer and
it allows you then to go through
processing and mixing or that delay and
latency created really isn't an issue it
also frees up CPU space for the
processing you're about to do while
we're on the topic of CPU let's talk
about freezing your tracks to do this
find a track that has heavy processing
right click and go to freeze track this
will temporarily create an audio file
for that track and disable the actual
plugins that are on it and if you want
to bring it back to edit some of those
plugins you could just hit unfreeze
it'll go back to the original midi
version and you have access to edit all
those plugins again at some point you
might have tried to export your song
long and instead of doing the whole song
it only exports 10 seconds a small

loop in bar to the beginning of the song
The Loop out bar to the end of the song
and then if you click inside that
horizontal Loop bar it will highlight
